concept.title: Jira integration in Katalon Platform overview

conbody.p: can integrate with Jira Cloud, and Jira Data Center (Jira Server). To enable Jira Integration in , follow this guide: Enable Jira integration in Katalon Studio.

Jira Software is a project management tool that helps you plan, assign, track, manage, and report on your work. Jira Software can be customized to fit in with any type of project, and for many different use cases. To learn more about Jira use cases, refer to this Jira document: What is Jira used for?
With Jira - integration, you can manage test cases with linked Jira tickets, and create Behavior-driven development (BDD) test scenarios alongside related requirements and stories.

Integrating Jira with helps you:
Import test cases from Jira to to create test cases and run BDD tests.
Automatically submit test results and test reports to the linked Jira issue. See View test results in Jira tickets.
Submit an issue to Jira directly from the test reports page of . See .
This document gives information about the Jira - integration workflow.

section.title: Configure Jira integration
section.p: uses 2 plugins and 1 optional extension to integrate with Jira:

ol.li: You need a plugin on Jira side for both and integration. In Jira, install this plugin from the Atlassian Marketplace website: Katalon Studio and TestOps integration.
If you use as your test authoring tool, you need to install this plugin from the Katalon Store to enable Jira integration in : Jira Integration.
Optional: This Chrome extension allows you to submit test run defects from TestOps to Jira: Katalon Integration.

section.p:
To complete the integration setup, follow these guides:
- Jira integration guide: .
- Jira integration guide: .

section.title: Plan your tests
section.p: Jira - integration allows you to plan and manage your test in . You can:

ul.li: Populate Jira releases. See Populate Jira releases.
Link test cases to Jira requirements. See Link test cases to Jira requirements.
Write BDD scenarios right inside Jira tickets. See .

section.p: After creating a release, you can link test runs to a release. See .

section.title: Organize your tests
section.p: With Jira - integration, you can import BDD fields and test cases from Jira to . You can also continue scripting your BDD test scenarios. See Import BDD fields and test cases from Jira to Katalon Studio.

section.title: View and analyze test results
section.p: After you execute your tests, you can automatically sync your test results to Jira for your team to view:
For detailed instructions, refer to: Manage BDD test cases with Jira integration.
You can also view BDD test results in . See .

With these test results, you can easily submit bugs to your Jira project:
Submit an issue to Jira directly from the test report page of . See .
Link test runs to Jira defects. See .

Analyze reports: In TestOps dashboard, you can get a full picture of your test coverage with the linked requirements. This allows you to centralize all Jira and BDD requirements in one single place for reports and analytics. See .
